grant-agency.organization: National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke
National Institute of Child Health and Human Development

grantList.grant-text: Acknowledgments We thank Elaine Tam for technical assistance with collecting blood samples, Youliang Lou for performing the pyrosequencing assays, and The Centre for Applied Genomics for providing DNA samples from typically developing children. E.S. was supported by an Autism Speaks Weatherstone Predoctoral Fellowship (9093). This work was funded by grants from the Canadian Institutes for Health Research (MOP77720) to L.R.O., from the Simons Foundation Autism Research Initiative (238896) to C.B.M and L.R.O., and from the National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke (R01 NS35102) and the National Institute of Child Health and Development (R37 HD29957) to C.B.M.

grant-agency.organization: National Health and Medical Research Council

grantList.grant-text: Acknowledgments This work was supported by the National Health and Medical Research Council (grants 628952 and 1041920 to J.G.), the Channel 7 Children’s Research Foundation (R.K., M.F., and J.G.), the European Commission 7 th Framework Programme project Genetic and Epigenetic Networks in Cognitive Dysfunction (grant 241995 to H.H. and V.M.K.), the MS McLeod Research Fellowship from the Women’s and Children’s Hospital Foundation (to M.A.C.), and the Ter Meulen Fonds stipendium (to B.W.M.v.B). We thank Amanda Springer, Sharon Grosvenor, and Julie Rogerson for their help with the MRX12 family. The authors are also grateful to the families who participated in the study.

Acknowledgments This study was supported by the Alumni Association of University of Leicester PhD studentship and International Mentoring Travel Award by American Heart Association (to P.C.). M.T. is supported by the British Heart Foundation. N.J.S. holds a personal chair supported by the British Heart Foundation and is a UK NIHR senior investigator. C.P.N. is funded by the British Heart Foundation. The Cardiogenics project was supported by the European Union 6th Framework Program (LSHM - CT - 2006 - 037593). The UKBS collection of Common Controls has been funded by the Wellcome Trust grant 084183/Z/07/Z and by NIHR programme grant to NHSBT (RP - PG - 0310 - 1002). The collection was established as part of the WTCCC. We would like to thank the participants and members of the CARDIoGRAM and the Cardiogenics consortia. Members of the Cardiogenics Consortium are listed in the Supplemental Data .

Acknowledgments This work was supported through internal funds from the Medical Genomics Laboratory at the University of Alabama at Birmingham (UAB). We thank Alicia Gomes, the UAB Medical Genomics Laboratory certified genetic counselor, for helping with the institutional-review-board protocols.

Acknowledgments We thank the families for their participation. We also thank Leila Hakkakian, Judite De Oliveira, and Nadège Gigot for technical assistance and Prof. Andrew Green for referral of affected subjects, and we are grateful to the French Society of Fetal Pathology for participating in the study. This work was supported by grants from the Agence Nationale de la Recherche (ANR; 2010 fetal ciliopathies grant BLAN-1122-01 and 2013 cilia, axonal guidance, and corpus callosum grant ANR-13-BSV1-0027 to T.A.B.). C.A. is funded by the Fondation pour la Recherche Médicale and K.P. by grants from ANR. The Institut Imagine is supported by an ANR grant (ANR-A0-IAHU-01).
Acknowledgments We thank Eli Stahl, Stephan Ripke, and Dominika Sieradzka for discussions. This work was funded by the MRC (K006215).

Acknowledgments We would like to thank Alkes Price, Hillary Finucane, Robert Brown, Huwenbo Shi, and Nicholas Mancuso for helpful discussion and feedback on this work. This research was supported by NIH grants R01-HG006399, R01-GM53275, and R21-CA182821.

grant-agency.organization: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute
National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute

grantList.grant-text: Acknowledgments We thank all the families, clinicians, and investigators for their participation and support and the staff of GeneReviews and OMIM for assistance and access to data. We thank Colleen Davis, Seema Jamal, Kathryn Shively, and Colby Marvin for helpful discussion and technical assistance. This work was supported in part by National Human Genome Research Institute (NHGRI) and National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI) grants HG006504 (to the Yale Center for Mendelian Disorders), HG006542 (to the Baylor-Hopkins Center for Mendelian Genomics), and HG006493 (to the University of Washington Center for Mendelian Genomics). The content is solely the responsibility of the authors and does not necessarily represent the official views of the NHGRI and NHLBI of the NIH. J.R.L. has stock ownership in 23andMe, is a paid consultant for Regeneron Pharmaceuticals, has stock options in Lasergen Inc., is a member of the Scientific Advisory Board of Baylor Miraca Genetics Laboratories, and is a co-inventor on multiple US and European patents related to molecular diagnostics for inherited neuropathies, eye diseases, and bacterial genomic fingerprinting. The Department of Molecular and Human Genetics at Baylor College of Medicine (D.M. and J.R.L.) derives revenue from the chromosomal microarray analysis and clinical exome sequencing offered in the Baylor Miraca Genetics Laboratory ( http://www.bmgl.com/BMGL/Default.aspx ).
Acknowledgments We would like to thank Prof. Peter Visscher and Prof. Grant Montgomery for providing the lymphoblastoid cell lines used in this study.

Acknowledgments This work was supported by grants from the Medical Research Council UK (MC_U105697135 to J.R., C.A.P., A.D., and M.M.), the German Bundesministerium für Bildung und Forschung through funding of the E-Rare project GENOMIT (01GM1207 to T.M. and H.P.), the German Network or Mitochondrial Disorders (01GM1113C and 01GM0866 to T.M., H.P., and M.S.), the Juniorverbund in der Systemmedizin “mitOmics” (FKZ 01ZX1405C to T.B.H.), the German Center for Heart Research (Z76010017300 and Z56010015300 to T.M.), the Wellcome Trust Strategic Award (096919/Z/11/Z to R.W.T. and P.F.C.), the Medical Research Council Centre for Neuromuscular Diseases (G0601943 to R.W.T. and P.F.C.), the UK National Health Service Highly Specialised “Rare Mitochondrial Disorders of Adults and Children” Service (C.L.A. and R.W.T.), the Lily Foundation (R.W.T.), a National Institute for Health Research doctoral fellowship (NIHR-HCS-D12-03-04 to C.L.A.), and Telethon Italy grant GGP11011 (C. Dallabona, C. Donnini, and I.F.). P.F.C. is a Wellcome Trust Senior Fellow in Clinical Science (101876/Z/13/Z) and a UK National Institute for Health Research Senior Investigator.

Acknowledgments We are grateful to the individuals who participated in this study. We thank N. Suzuki, M. Saito, M. Kamata, and N. Fujita for their help in collecting the samples. We also thank T. Isono, S. Tominaga, Y. Takanashi, and T. Kusadokoro for technical assistance and N. Atsumi and S. Unger for English language editing.

grant-agency.organization: California Department of Fish and Game

grantList.grant-text: Acknowledgments We are grateful the families who contributed to this study. We thank Seymour Rosen, Heather J. Cordell, William G. Newman, Stanley Swierzewski III, Frank Croke, John Blanchete, Dicken Ko, Ghaleb Daouk, John Herrin, and the UK VUR Study Group for contributing renal pathology, radiology, and clinical materials. This research was supported by grants from the NIH to R.S.L. (DK096238), to R.P.L. (5U54HG006504), to H.J. (DK 46718), to W.L. (DK078226), and to F.H. (DK088767) and from the March of Dimes to W.L. and F.H. This work was supported by grants from the German Research Foundation (DFG) to S.S.L. within SFB1140 and the Emmy Noether programme and to A.K. by an individual grant (Ki728/7-1) and within the Cluster of Excellence REBIRTH (From Regenerative Biology to Reconstructive Therapy) at Hannover Medical School. A.S.W. received project grants from Kidney Research UK, the Medical Research Council (G0600040 and MR/L002744/1), and the Wellcome Trust (066647). H.M.S. was funded by fellowships from NIHR UK and the Wellcome Trust. A.S.W.’s and H.M.S.’s research was facilitated by the Manchester Academic Health Sciences Centre. A.V. is a recipient of a Fulbright postdoctoral scholar award and of a Manton Center fellowship award from Boston Children’s Hospital. F.H. and R.P.L. are Investigators of the Howard Hughes Medical Institute. F.H. is the Warren E. Grupe Professor of Pediatrics at Harvard Medical School.

Acknowledgments The authors thank all the individuals with neuropsychiatric disorders and their family members who participated in this study. This work was supported in part by NIH grant P01CA142538. The content is solely the responsibility of the authors and does not necessarily represent the official views of the NIH.
Acknowledgments The authors acknowledge support from NIH grants HG000376 (M.B.), HG007022 (G.R.A.), and HG006513 (G.R.A.).

Acknowledgments We thank the families for their contribution. Drs. Jillian Parboosingh, Francois Bernier, and Ryan Lamont contributed to the study design, data interpretation, and X-inactivation studies of individual 8. Drs. Concetta Barone and Paolo Bosco were instrumental for clinical evaluation and X-inactivation studies in individual 13. Miriam Uppill provided technical assistance with investigations in family 1. This work was supported by a grant from the Netherlands Organization for Health Research and Development (ZonMw grant 907-00-365 to T.K.), the Italian Ministry of Health and ‘5 per mille’ funding (C.R.), a grant from the Alberta Children’s Hospital Foundation (A.M.I.), a NIH Training Grant (5T32HD060558-04 to E.C.M.), German Ministry of Education and Research (01GS08166 to N.D.D. and A.R.), the EU FP7 project GENCODYS (grant number 241995 to V.M.K.), Australian NH&MRC grants 628952 and 1041920 to J.G., support from the Simons Foundation (W.K.C.), Doris Duke Charitable Foundation Clinical Scientist Development Award (M.C.K.), a grant from the Marguerite-Marie Delacroix Foundation (A.V.D.), and FWO-Flanders (H.V.E. and F.K.). B.L. is a senior clinical investigator supported by Fund for Scientific Research Flanders and holds an ERC starting grant. Acknowledgments of the DDD Study are included in the Supplemental Data .
Acknowledgement This work was supported by Savanah River National Lab under the U.S. DOE Contract DE-AC09-96SR18500.
Acknowledgment We thank Fabio Vito for technical support.

Acknowledgments EMB thanks useful comments by D. Schwen, P. Erhart, and K. Nordlund, and support from PICT-0092 and a SeCTyP-UNCuyo grant. This work was supported by the Fondo Nacional de Investigaciones Científicas y Tecnológicas (FONDECYT, Chile) under grants #3140526 (RG), #1120399 and 1130272 (MK), and Financiamiento Basal para Centros Científicos y Tecnológicos de Excelencia FB-0807 (RG, FV, JM, and MK). FV was supported by CONICYT Doctoral Fellowship grant #21140948.

Acknowledgements The present scientific contribution is dedicated to the 650th anniversary of the foundation of the University of Pécs, Hungary. The authors acknowledge the Hungarian–Chinese Intergovernmental S&T Cooperation Programme (Project No.: TÉT_12_CN-1-2012-0040, CH-6-26/2012) and the SROP-4.2.2.D-15/1/Konv-2015-0015 project for their financial supports. This work was also supported partially by the Natural Science Foundation of Fujian Province of China, No.: 2015J01028. Authors express their gratitude to Prof. Dr. Miklós Nyitrai and Ilike Brunnerné (Department of Biophysics, University of Pécs) for offering ultracentrifugation equipment. Authors also appreciate the helps from Dr. Barna Kovács and Dr. Aleksandar Secenji (Department of General and Physical Chemistry, University of Pécs) in TGA measurements. YL is grateful to Dr. Jan M. Englert (ZMP, University of Erlangen–Nuremberg) for his valuable suggestions concerning scanning Raman spectroscopy.
Acknowledgments We acknowledge the support of Department of Science and Technology, New Delhi. We thank Gargi Mishra for her help in the fabrication of MCC.
Acknowledgments The authors thank Dr. Fei Deng from the Department of Materials Science Engineering at the University of Delaware for his significant technical support with SEM measurements.

Acknowledgements The authors wish to express thanks to Dr. K. Nagarajan and Dr. U. Kamachi Mudali for their encouragement and support to this work. We sincerely acknowledge the help of Dr. Ch. Jagadeeswara Rao and A. Ravi Shankar for their help in the SEM imaging of the graphite samples and Mr. N. Sanil, Mrs. L. Shakila and Mr. V. Arun Kumar for their help in the electrolysis experiments. Dr. D. Sri Maha Vishnu and Dr. Jagadeesh Sure acknowledge the grant of the research fellowship from IGCAR, Department of Atomic Energy, India.

grant-agency.organization: Ministry of Education, Science and Technology

grantList.grant-text: Acknowledgment Tsu-Wei Chou thanks the support of the National Research Foundation of Korea through the Korean Ministry for Education, Science and Technology (MEST). Ping Xu’s study abroad at the University of Delaware is supported by the State Scholarship Fund of the China Scholarship Council as well as Doctorial Innovation Fund of Donghua University.

Acknowledgments This work was supported by grants of Saint Petersburg State University (11.38.271.2014 and 15.61.202.2015), Russian Foundation for Basic Research (RFBR) projects (Project No. 13-02-91327) and was performed in the framework of a collaboration between the Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft and RFBR (RA 1041/3-1). The authors acknowledge support from Russian–German laboratory at BESSY II, the program “German–Russian Interdisciplinary Science Center” (G-RISC) and the Resource Center of Saint-Petersburg State University “Physical Methods of Surface Investigation”.

grant-agency.organization: National Natural Science Foundation of China

grantList.grant-text: Acknowledgment This work was financially supported by the National Natural Science Foundation of China (No.51322603, 51136001, 51356001), the Program for New Century Excellent Talents in University, Tsinghua National Laboratory for Information Science and Technology, and Science Fund for Creative Research Group (No. 51321002). Tianli Feng and Xiulin Ruan acknowledge partial support from the US National Science Foundation CAREER Award (Grant No. 1150948).

grant-agency.organization: Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation

grantList.grant-text: Acknowledgements The authors acknowledge Deakin University for providing the PhD scholarships. We thank Dr. David Fox (CSIRO) and Dr. Xiangping Sun (Deakin) for developing the software to automatically measure the cyclic tensile strength and conductivity). We also thank Dr. Jane Dai, and Gayathri Devi Rajmohan for providing the SourceMeter. We thank Dr. Anthony Somers (Burwood Campus, Deakin University, Australia) for the thickness measurement, Dr. Mark Nave and Dr. Andrew Sullivan for discussion about SEM imaging, Dr. Rob Jones (Latrobe University, Victoria, Australia) for assistance with XPS test, and Sandy Benness and John Robin for the technical supports.

Acknowledgements Authors are thankful for the technical support and facilities at CIMAV Monterrey and Chalmers University of Technology, Department of Materials and Manufacturing Technology, as well as to the Mexican National Research Council CONACyT for the scholarship. Lilia Bautista and Nayely Pineda for UV–Vis spectra and SEM micrographs, respectively, are also acknowledged.

Acknowledgments The authors thank Jean-François Marêché for his technical help for the chemical treatments. The authors would like to thank Lionel Aranda for his help for TGA experiments and Anne Vernière for her help during the Mössbauer measurements. The authors thank Pascal Franchetti for his technical help for Raman spectroscopy investigation.

Acknowledgment The submitted manuscript has been created by UChicago Argonne, LLC, Operator of Argonne National Laboratory (“Argonne”). Argonne, a U.S. Department of Energy Office of Science laboratory, is operated under Contract No. DE-AC02-06CH11357. The U.S. government retains for itself, and others acting on its behalf, a paid-up nonexclusive, irrevocable worldwide license in said article to reproduce, prepare derivative works, distribute copies to the public, perform publicly and display publicly, by or on behalf of the government. The authors thank the Advanced Engine Combustion Program at the U.S. Department of Energy Office of Vehicle Technologies, Corning Inc. and Hyundai motor company for their support. Furthermore, the use of the TEM instruments at the Center for Nanoscale Materials facility and the Electron Microscopy Center was supported by the U. S. Department of Energy, Office of Science, Office of Basic Energy Sciences.
Acknowledgements The authors would like to thank Jeff McGrew for advice on mutant generation and Ganesh Vedantham and Eva Gefroh for critical reading of this manuscript.

Acknowledgements The authors would like to acknowledge the help of Dr. Richard Wilson and Dr. Noel Davies of the Central Science Laboratory, University of Tasmania for providing mass spectrometry support.

Acknowledgements We kindly thank Prof. Enrico Marcantoni for the useful discussions about the study presented. We would also like to thank Sheila Beatty for editing the English usage of the manuscript.
Acknowledgements We wish to thank all patients and parents who participated in this study.
Acknowledgments The manuscript of this article was submitted by the first author in partial fulfillment of the requirements for the degree in master of public health.
Acknowledgements Participant expenses were paid by the Department of Psychology, Humboldt Universität zu Berlin.
Acknowledgments None.
Acknowledgements Our special thanks go to the staff and service users of OASIS.
Acknowledgments We thank our subjects for participating in this study.

Acknowledgment We thank Dr. Maren Schneider and Dr. Stefanie Bokemeyer for their assistance in interviewing patients, in data collection and general support; Birgit Wiese and Nelly Simetska for their epidemiological guidance and help in statistical analysis; and Prof. Dr. Uwe Hartmann for helpful comments on an earlier draft of the manuscript. We thank all our patients and controls who participated in this study. We received no financial support for this study.

Acknowledgments We want to thank for the support and for providing the patients to the Mental Health division of Althaia Foundation, Man Project Foundation from Catalonia, ATRA group and the Mental Health and Addictions Division of Mataró Hospital. We are grateful to Silvia López-Vera who assisted in collecting data.

Acknowledgments The authors thank Miwako Nakamura, Kaoru Ikeda, Chisako Fujishiro, Kyoko Tanabe, Ayumi Uchida, Nao Miyazaki, Aya Hattori, Komako Ito (Chiba University), the staff of the Department of Nursing, Chiba University Hospital, and Chiba University Hospital Clinical Research Center for their assistance with this trial.

Acknowledgments This research was supported by the UM Department of Psychology provided for Dr. Patricia Deldin, and Rackham Graduate School provided for Dr. Philip Cheng. We would also like to thank the Department of Psychiatry, and the Depression Center for their continued support.

Acknowledgments We thank the patients for their participation, the psychiatrists/psychologists of the involved wards for their support, and Almut Carolus and Petia Popova for administrative support in data acquisition. The University of Konstanz supported the project.

Acknowledgements The authors are thankful to the staff and service users of the Early Intervention Teams and Adult Education Colleges for their participation in this study. Additionally, helpful advice regarding mediational analysis was provided by Dr Filippo Varese.

Acknowledgment We would like to show our great appreciation to the clinical staff and participants at the hospitals for their support and assistance in data collection. There was no external funding for this study.
Acknowledgments We wish to thank Carmela Chateau-Smith for her significant assistance with the preparation of this paper and Myriam Gravelle and Georges Edme for their help with collecting data.
Acknowledgment The authors are grateful to the participants and the nursing staff of Anhui Mental Health Center in this study for their support in the data collection.

Acknowledgements We acknowledge the support provided by the Cognitive Psychotherapy Schools “Studi Cognitivi” and “Psicoterapia e Ricerca” of Milano, Italy, by the School of Applied Sciences of the London South Bank University, by the Azienda Sanitaria di Bolzano, Bolzano, Italy, by the University of Milano-Bicocca of Milano, Italy, and by the Macquarie University of Sydney, Australia.
Acknowledgments We want to thank for providing the patients to the Gressol Man Project Foundation in Catalonia, Red Cross, Vall d’Hebron University Hospital, ATRA and Septimania Association.

Acknowledgments Thanks to the NIMH Center for Collaborative Genetic Studies on Mental Disorders and the Psychiatric GWAS Consortium (PGC) for providing their full sample GWAS results, individual quality controlled genotypes, and individual level dosage data for distribution to qualified investigators. We are deeply grateful to the NIMH, United States (N01 MH900001; 2N01MH080001-001), for their sponsorship of the PGC.
Acknowledgment The authors appreciate all the participating survivors of the disaster and the investigators.
Acknowledgements All authors declare no Conflicts of Interest and Source of Funding.

Acknowledgement The research project PSYCHOCOKE received a grant from the French Ministry of Health (Programme Hospitalier de Recherche Clinique National 2010, AOM10165), and is promoted by the DRCD (Direction de la Recherche Clinique et du Developpement) of the Assistance Publique–Hopitaux de Paris.
Acknowledgments The authors of this paper are grateful for the assistance of the following people: Ahuva Netzer, Eran Maresse, Marsel Dahari, Mazi Amos, Riva Alkalay and Steven Flint.

Acknowledgments The author would like to thank Prof. Steffen Moritz for his help in collecting data for the healthy control group and for his valuable comments on an earlier version of the manuscript.
Acknowledgements There are no conflicts of interest to report.

Acknowledgments This research was made possible by the collaboration of Instituto de Trabajo Social y de Servicios Sociales (Intress), which manages many of the centers which make up the public social care network for people with mental illness in the Communities of Madrid, Catalonia and the Balearic Islands.
Acknowledgement None
Acknowledgements The authors would like to thank Lian Roebers (Rijnstate hospital) for her assistance in data collection. There was no funding source and no writing assistance.

grant-agency.organization: Ministry of Science and Technology of the People's Republic of China

grantList.grant-text: Acknowledgments The study was supported by the “12th Five-year” National Key Technology R&D Program of China [Ministry of Science and Technology of the People's Republic of China] (No. 2012ZX09303006-002) and Zhejiang Beta Pharma Inc. (Zhejiang, China).
Acknowledgements The authors thank Mr. Yongqiang Xie and Mr. Xinhua Xue for technical supports.
Acknowledgement We thank Dr. Hongyan Xu from the Department of Biostatistics and Epidemiology, Medical College of Georgia, Georgia Regents University for his critical review and comments.

Acknowledgements This was an investigator-initiated study funded and supported by Novartis, Genentech, and the Stanford Clinical and Translational Research Unit (National Center for Advancing Translational Sciences UL1 TR001085 at the National Institutes of Health). This work was conducted with support from the TL1 Clinical Research Training Program of the Stanford Clinical and Translational Science Award to Spectrum (NIH TL1 TR 001084) and the Stanford Cancer Institute Fellowship Award ( SKP ); National Institutes of Health (NICHD K23 HD 079557) ( AF ); and the National Institutes of Health (K12 CA 138464) ( JWR ).

Acknowledgements The paper was created as part of the task ‘ Risk assessment for incidence and death of asbestos - related diseases among persons occupationally exposed to asbestos dust on the basis of long-term epidemiological observation’ ( NIOM , 10.14 ). The authors of this publication would like to thank all the people who cooperated in implementation of the ‘Amiantus’ project, particularly the physicians who performed periodic examinations in the regional centers of occupational medicine and those who encoded radiological changes.
Acknowledgments The authors are grateful to the enrolled patients and to the staff of the five participating institutions.

Acknowledgments Exceptionally, we thank Sven Gunia, MD, FRCPath (Department of Pathology at the Johanniter Hospital Stendal, Germany) for his contribution in the histopathologic evaluation of the study cases enrolled in the present study and for providing insight and expertise that greatly assisted the research. We thank Stefanie Götz and Nina Niessl (Department of Urology, Regensburg University, St. Josef Medical Center, Regensburg, Germany) for assistance with immunohistochemistry. In alphabetical order, we would like to express our thanks to the following department directors who kindly supported the present study by providing archival slides and wax-embedded tissues for investigations: V. Henn, MD (Department of Pathology, Ruppiner Clinics GmbH, Germany), J. Jander, MD (Department of Pathology, Rhön Clinic Frankfurt/Oder, Germany), H. Lobeck, MD (Department of Pathology, Ernst-von-Bergmann Clinic Potsdam, Germany), R. Pauli, MD (Department of Pathology, Health Care Center Brandenburg an der Havel GmbH, Germany), Uwe Schmidt (Outpatient Department of Urology, Görlitz, Germany) and M. Tuffaha (Department of Pathology, Carl-Thiem Clinic Cottbus, Germany).

Acknowledgments We thank Angela Gröbner, Christiane Geier, Cornelius Wölfel and other colleagues from the institute of pathology for technical assistance. Further, we are indebted to Piere Rogalla and Sven Hauke from ZytoVision GmbH for providing the KRAS/CEN12 and CEN4/CEN10 dual color FISH probes. Last but not least we thank Hans-Joachim Schulz and Thomas Meier for providing tumor samples.

Acknowledgments There are of course many contributors to a literature review such as this and hence any omissions are apologized for in advance. The authors would like to thank in particular the risk and cost estimation communities at ACostE, Rolls-Royce plc., and Cranfield University.

grant-agency.organization: Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare

grantList.grant-text: Acknowledgements We thank National Institute of Animal Health, Japan for kindly providing the bovine ephemeral fever virus YHL strain and anti-BEFV rabbit sera. This experiment was supported by grants from the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare of Japan (H24-Shinko-Ippan-006; H25-Shinko-Ippan-008).

Acknowledgements This work was supported by 31372465 from the National Science Grant of China and a project funded by the Priority Academic Program Development of Jiangsu Higher Education Institutions (PAPD).

Acknowledgements This work was supported by (i) the Laboratoire d’épidémiologie d’infections enzootiques des herbivores en Tunisie (LR02AGRO3), funded by (ii) the Ministry of Higher Education and Scientific Research of Tunisia, the research project Epidémiologie de maladies bactériennes à transmission vectorielle des herbivores (06-680-0029) which is funded by the Ministry of Agriculture of Tunisia and (iii) the research project PS1.3.023–RESTUS funded by the European Neighbourhood and Partnership Instrument (ENPI) - Transboundary Cooperation (TC) - Italy-Tunisia 2007-2013. The authors would like to thank Dr. Leïla Sayhi (Sejnane), Dr. Hichem Talhaoui (Joumine), Dr. Rabeh Bouazizi (El Alia) and Dr. Samir Touil (Amdoun). They are also grateful to Dr. Safa Aouled Amor, Farhat Ben Khedher, Fethi Jelassi, and Khaled Souissi for their technical support. They are thankful to Pr. Ali Bouattour for his assistance in ticks’ identification and to Pr. Armanda Bastos for providing DNA of A. bovis .

Acknowledgements The authors thank Kerstin Rohn for excellent technical assistance in using the TEM. This work was supported by the European Community’s Seventh Framework Programme (FP7 2007-2013) under grant agreement number PITN-GA-2008-214505.

Acknowledgements The authors wish to thank Josh Filson and Jennifer Staten for their assistance with the animal housing and care. This work was supported by the National Pork Checkoff and the Ohio Pork Producers Council under project number 14-151.

Acknowledgements We wish to express our sincere thanks to Lara Nicholson and Eduard Roos, University of Pretoria, for technical assistance. This research was supported by the Deanship of Scientific Research at King Saud University through the research group project number RGP_020 (ANA, OBM, NCB), and by individual (ADSB), chair (NCB) and facilities (No: UID78566) grants awarded by the National Research Foundation of South Africa.

grant-agency.organization: Comisión Nacional de Investigación Científica y Tecnológica

grantList.grant-text: Acknowledgements This work was supported in part by grants CONICYT/FONDAP/15110027 from the Comisión Nacional de Investigación Científica y tecnológica (Chile) and AGL2013-42628-R from the Ministerio de Economía y Competitividad (Spain). A.L. acknowledges the Ministerio de Economía y Competitividad (Spain) for a research fellowship.

Acknowledgements This work was supported by National Animal Health Laboratory Network (NAHLN) and the Iowa State University Veterinary Diagnostic Laboratory. The sponsors had no role in designing, data collection, interpretation of the results, or writing of the manuscript. The authors have no potential conflicts of interest with respect to the research, authorship and/or publication of this manuscript. The authors thank Wendy Stensland, Laura Bradner, Joe Thompson and Joseph Brodie for assistance with testing and providing the samples for this study. The authors also thank Brett Crim for his technical assistance.

Acknowledgements This work was supported by the Veterinary Summer Research Grants from Department of Biomedical Sciences, College of Veterinary Medicine at Oregon State University. We also like to thank Dr. Jorge Vanegas for the assistance of cow blood collection.

Acknowledgements This study complied with the animal care regulations and applicable national laws in Gabon. Samples were taken by the CIRMF veterinarian, Barthélemy Ngoubangoye, accredited FELASA (Federation of European Laboratory Animal Science associations) n°2011-38. We thank the technicians and veterinarians from the CIRMF for their help in collecting data and Robin Buckland for having carefully read and corrected the English of the paper. This work was performed within the framework of the LABEX ECOFECT (ANR-11-LABX-0048) of Université de Lyon, within the program ‘Investissements d'Avenir’ (ANR-11-IDEX-0007) operated by the French National Research Agency (ANR).

grant-agency.organization: Universidade do Estado do Rio de Janeiro

grantList.grant-text: Acknowledgements This study was supported by FAPERJ, CNPq and CAPES. WL, FZB and MAM are CNPq fellows. The authors thank Leonardo Galileu Meirelles (IVB) for his help on sampling, Prof. Dr. Rafael Hirata (UERJ) for his help in immunofluorescence, and G. Martins (UFF) for his help on statistics.

grant-agency.organization: National Natural Science Foundation of China

grantList.grant-text: Acknowledgments This study was supported by Natural Science Foundation of China (grant no. 31302098); National Basic Research Program of China (973 Plan, grant no. 2014CB542700) Dr. Jiang is a staff of Shanghai Veterinary Research Institute, Chinese Academic of Agricultural Sciences. His research focus is on epidemiology and molecular biology and vaccinology of porcine reproductive and respiratory syndrome virus.

Acknowledgements and funding All French veterinarians reporting cases to the RESPE are gratefully acknowledged. Christel MARCILLAUD-PITEL and Charlène DAIX are gratefully acknowledged for their help with data collection, and Julie Storme for her valuable assistance in manuscript editing. Laboratory Franc Duncombe, Caen France is acknowledged for their analytical work. This study was funded by the RESPE.

Acknowledgments We thank Sibylle Bürki, of the Institute for Veterinary Bacteriology, Vetsuisse Faculty University of Bern, Switzerland, for mycoplasma preparation. The Staphylococcus aureus strain 1904 was kindly provided by Prof. R. Stephan, Institute for Food Safety and Hygiene, Vetsuisse Faculty University of Zurich, Switzerland.

Acknowledgments The authors thank Dr. Y.K. Choi (Chungbuk National University, Cheongju, Korea) and Dr. Man Ki Song (Laboratory Science Division, International Vaccine Institute, Seoul, Republic of Korea) for providing the challenge viruses and cholera toxin (CT) respectively. This study was supported by The Internal Research Fund of Animal, Plant and Fisheries Quarantine and Inspection Agency (QIA) (Grant no. Z-1541779, 2013-1181)], the Small and Medium Business Administration (S2130867) and Chungnam National University in 2014.
Acknowledgements This research was supported by a grant from Animal and Plant Quarantine Agency, Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs, Anyang, Republic of Korea.

Acknowledgements The authors wish to thank Dr. James Gilkerson, University of Melbourne for providing the equine adenovirus isolate used in this study. CG was a recipient of a University of South Australia Postgraduate Award.

Acknowledgments The authors are very grateful to the reviewers and the Associate Editor Prof. Jin-Yi Cai, for their comments and suggestions that improved the presentation and quality of this paper. The authors thank the 266 nephrologists who participated to the survey and helped us understand their practice pattern. The authors also thank Dr. Yves Gendreike (University Hospital of Nice), who provided data on procedure codings. We acknowledge the catheterization expertise of Drs Nobuhiro Suematsu of Fukuoka Red Cross Hospital, Tatsuya Shiraki of Kansai Rosai Hospital, Yoshiaki Shintani of Shin Koga Hospital, Yusuke Miyashita of Shinshu University School of Medicine, Masashi Fukunaga of Hyogo College of Medicine, Taketsugu Tsuchiya of Kanazawa Medical University, and Makoto Utsunomiya of Tokyo Rosai Hospital. Special acknowledgments to Julie Flahive, MS who contributed to the data collection and statistical analysis for the article. Acknowledgements to Andres Schanzer, MD and Donald T. Baril, MD who contributed to the manuscript and final approval of the article. Acknowledgements to David H. Stone, MD, Jeffrey A. Kalish, MD, and Virendra I. Patel who participated in critical review of the article. Rachelle N. Damle participated in drafting of the manuscript for the article. We would like to thank M.M.H.C. Bijvelds, M.J.W. van Galen, and A. Boekee, students at Fontys University of Applied Sciences, Department of Physiotherapy, for support in patient measurements, as well as F.A.M. Brooijmans, physical therapist, for using his equipment and practice. Notably, foam sclerotherapy was not inferior to surgical treatment. Therefore, our results indicate that foam sclerotherapy is an alternative to surgical treatment that is particularly suitable for high surgical risk patients presenting with advanced venous insufficiency and an active ulcer. The authors are grateful to I. Koshima (The University of Tokyo) and N. Murai, H. Tsubaki, and S. Harasawa (Saiseikai Kawaguchi General Hospital) for their support in helping deliver the best lymphatic treatment for our patients; S. Tange and M. Zhou of Tokyo University; and K. Tatebayashi and K. Miyazaki of Nagara Medical Center. The report sponsor had no role in the data collection or manuscript writing and submission process. The authors thank Pr. Alan Dardik (Yale University, USA), Pr. Réda Hassen-Khodja, and Dr. Serge Declemy (University of Nice–Sophia Antipolis, France) for the revision of the article, as well as Mr. Benjamin Maes (University of Nice–Sophia Antipolis, France) for his professional artistic drawings. The authors would like to thank Major Krystal Bean, Mr. Eugene Cauley, Ms. R. Rochelle Newsome, and Ms. Leticia Simon for their support with animal care and surgery. Thanks to Dr. Bradley Bandera for his assistance in surgical procedures. Thanks to Dr. Moo Wong for his expertise in the pathologic review. Thanks to First Lieutenant Tiffany Schlueter for her assistance in the editing process. The authors would like to thank Prof Michael Sheaff, Consultant Pathologist, Dr Sandeep Pathak, Consultant Radiologist, and Mr Stephen Brearley, Consultant Surgeon, Whipps Cross Hospital, UK for their kind input to this article. The authors are grateful for the total cooperation received from Eri Saeki, Izumi Masuda, Sachiko Kimura, and Shigeru Harasawa (Saiseikai Kawaguchi General Hospital).
Acknowledgments The present article was financially supported by Shiraz University of Medical Sciences grants No. 91-01-36-4870.

(H.J.K.); and the Hematology Tissue Bank of the Emory University School of Medicine and the Georgia Cancer Coalition (H.J.K.). ACRISP is one of the designated International Olympic Committee centres for research into the prevention of injury and protection of athlete health.
